text:
Only .jar archives in the WEB-INF/lib directory are considered, .zip files 
containing classes are ignored.

Renaming the .zip file to .jar solves the problem, but this is annoying because 
you have to do it every time you get a new version - some vendors only ship 
class archives as .zip files (e.g. Oracle JDBC drivers).
creator: hboeger@kabel.de
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Tomcat follows the servlet specifidation with regards to this, and it will not
be changed.  If it were to be changed, any application that depended on it would
be locked to running only on Tomcat, because it's the same for all other servlet
containers as well.
